question: An automobile financier claims to be lending money at simple interest, but he includes the interest every six months for calculating the principal. If he is charging an interest of 10%, the effective rate of interest becomes:
answer_description: Let the sum be Rs. 100. Then,S.I. for first 6 months = Rs.100 x 10 x 1= Rs. 5100 x 2S.I. for last 6 months = Rs.105 x 10 x 1= Rs. 5.25100 x 2So, amount at the end of 1 year = Rs. (100 + 5 + 5.25) = Rs. 110.25Effective rate = (110.25 - 100) = 10.25%

answer_description: Let the original rate be R%. Then, new rate = (2R)%.Note:Here, original rate is for 1 year(s); the new rate is for only 4 months i.e.year(s).725 x R x 1+362.50 x 2R x 1= 33.50100100 x 3(2175 + 725) R = 33.50 x 100 x 3(2175 + 725) R = 10050(2900)R = 10050R =10050= 3.462900Original rate = 3.46%
